Articles.Content:
Hello there!

I was looking through some old pictures of .25 and .90, and it made me realize how wonderful a modded sunflare (KSPRC, AVP, Better Atmospheres) made everything look. I've tried to install a .90 sunflare into 1.0, but saw somewhere that sunflares don't work between versions because the shared assets files change every update.

But, a few weeks ago, I was looking at one of pingopete's RSS albums, and saw that he had a modded sunflare.

> 
> 
> > [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/2jMLC)
> 
> 
> 

So how do I do this? Where do I download it?

Many thanks.

EDIT: album fixed.

You can download one of there packs like RVE-KSP-1.0.4 has a file sharedassets9.assets you copy it to KSP/KSP\_Data hope it helps.

> 
> You can download one of there packs like RVE-KSP-1.0.4 has a file sharedassets9.assets you copy it to KSP/KSP\_Data hope it helps.

Can confirm, sunflare.tex is now loacted in sharedassets9.assets, as mention by MeCripp you'd just need to put this in KSP\_data and overwrite. HOWEVER The stock flare likely won't be bright enough. RVE used configs to make the sun flare bright enough, so you'd need to figure out how to encorperate this node into a non-RVE/RSS game. There may also be an issue with the texture's scale being wrong in a differently sized solar system.

Hmm. I'm loading up the game with the RVE sunflare now. We'll see how it goes.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/a1aQp)

Yeah ok so we can see that the flare aspect is present but as expected is far to dim/transparent; this is the node which alters it's brightness for RVE:

    @Kopernicus:FOR[RVE]{    @Body[Sun]    {        @ScaledVersion        {            %SolarLightColor            {                %sunLensFlareColor = 33, 33, 33, 1                %sunAU = 1                !sunBrigthnessCurve {}                sunBrigthnessCurve                    {                    key = 0 300000 0 0                    key = 1530000000 150000 0 0                    key = 80000000000 100000 0 0                    }            }        }    }}

You might be able to just create a text file (called something.cfg), paste this code into it and put the .cfg into your gamedata, though it may well also not work so give it a try if you want ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I think the reason why it turns yellow is because that's the actual sun's color behind the flare itself. It's probably because you're not using RSS, I think.

Also, the config needs Kopernicus in order to work.

I recently asked the same question, check out the answer I got for manually installing a lens flare:

> 
> There's this [beautiful lens flare](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/44135-0-22-Universe-Replacer-v4-0?p=849201&viewfull=1#post849201) (which I use) in the Universe Replacer thread, and the way you install it (or any lens flare) is in [this post](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/44135-0-22-Universe-Replacer-v4-0/page38?p=577857&viewfull=1#post577857). Note that the lens flare is now in the sharedassets9.assets file, not sharedassets10.assets.
